content.description: Start with right hand on a sidepull around head height.  Work your way up increasingly good holds on the slightly overhanging wall.
content.protection: a couple pads is nice.  hard to spot the climber on this one.
content.location: This boulder problem is on the far left side of the Saloon Wall boulder.

content.description: Stand start and head straight up keeping right of the arete. The crux comes early and eases off at the end. Because this is a classic, it's a little easy for the grade. This problem has sweet edges and pinches on it which makes you forget about how tall it is.
content.location: When facing the boulder, this problem is on the left hand side. Start with left hand on the arete and a good right hand side pull.

content.description: The rock hides a lot of holds for this boulder. Pull on the start and maneuver through a series of bad holds (both feet and hands). Gain high feet and chuck for a semi flat ledge "jug." The catch rewards you with an incredibly easy topout.
content.location: Stand start matched on an obvious chalked and good right facing sidepull. Head up and slightly right.

content.description: Start on two small crimps and a huge foot and head straight up the face, aiming for a large flat hold.
content.location: On the Saloon Wall, just to the right of Lighter Than Air.

content.description: Start at the big flat hold on the right side of the face of the boulder.  Use bad feet to try to gain the large ledge at half height on the boulder.  From there it is a bit tricky to stand up on the ledge and top out.
content.location: This problem is on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Saloon Wall is right by the St. Croix River. This boulder often gets sun in the afternoon and hosts a variety of problems. The landings are pretty good and can be well protected. It is a great spot to chill for the day.
